H0.text: for complaints of sudden chest pain patients should take a. Ibuprofen

H1.text: for complaints of sudden chest pain patients should take a. Nitroglycerin

H2.text: for complaints of sudden chest pain patients should take a. Oxygen

H3.text: for complaints of sudden chest pain patients should take a. Aspirin

A4.text: Patients experiencing angina when doing certain physical activities can often prevent symptoms by taking nitroglycerin 5 to 10 minutes before the activity.

A5.text: Nitroglycerin is probably most commonly prescribed for angina pectoris, a painful symptom of ischemic heart disease caused by inadequate flow of blood and oxygen to the heart
